intro: Cephaelis harmandiana, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink and white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive, fan-like appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
